name: Email Accessibility
description: Accessibility checks to ensure emails are accessible to all users

seo.title: Email Accessibility Checklist v1.0.0 | lksy.org
seo.description: 15 accessibility checks for email to ensure WCAG compliance and accessibility for all users.

checks.name: Alt Text for Images
checks.description: All images must have descriptive alt text
checks.rationale: Screen readers rely on alt text to describe images

checks.name: Color Contrast Ratio
checks.description: Text must meet WCAG AA contrast ratio (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text)
checks.rationale: Low contrast makes text unreadable for many users

checks.name: Color Not Used Alone
checks.description: Information must not be conveyed by color alone
checks.rationale: Colorblind users cannot distinguish color-only information

checks.name: Descriptive Link Text
checks.description: Links must have descriptive text (not 'click here' or 'read more')
checks.rationale: Screen reader users navigate by links

checks.name: Proper Heading Structure
checks.description: Use proper heading hierarchy (h1, h2, h3) for structure
checks.rationale: Screen readers use headings for navigation

checks.name: Table Headers
checks.description: Tables must have proper header cells (th elements)
checks.rationale: Screen readers need headers to understand table structure

checks.name: Minimum Font Size
checks.description: Body text must be at least 14px (16px recommended)
checks.rationale: Small text is difficult to read for many users

checks.name: Line Height
checks.description: Line height should be at least 1.5 times font size

checks.name: Language Attribute
checks.description: HTML lang attribute must be set
checks.rationale: Screen readers use language for proper pronunciation

checks.name: Skip Links
checks.description: Provide skip links for long emails
checks.rationale: Allows keyboard users to skip repetitive content

checks.name: Form Labels
checks.description: All form inputs must have associated labels
checks.rationale: Screen readers need labels to identify form fields

checks.name: Button Text
checks.description: Buttons must have descriptive text, not just images
checks.rationale: Screen readers need text to understand button purpose

checks.name: Keyboard Navigation
checks.description: All interactive elements must be keyboard accessible
checks.rationale: Many users navigate with keyboard only

checks.name: Focus Indicators
checks.description: Interactive elements must have visible focus indicators
checks.rationale: Users need to see which element has focus

checks.name: Text Alternative
checks.description: All non-text content must have text alternatives
checks.rationale: Screen readers cannot read images, videos, etc.
